channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Google employees grill Sundar Pichai and CFO Ruth Porat on why they're not getting pay rises amid blowout earnings
item.description: “Despite the company’s stellar performance and record earnings, many Googlers have not received meaningful compensation increases,” one top-rated question began.

item.title: Bank of England holds interest rates steady, but signals a cut is coming
item.description: The Bank of England confirmed a widely-expected hold in interest rates following its May meeting on Thursday.

item.title: AstraZeneca pulls its COVID-19 vaccine from European market after history of stumbles
item.description: Partial results from its first major trial — which Britain used to authorize the vaccine — were clouded by a manufacturing mistake that researchers didn’t immediately acknowledge.

item.title: A rare hostile takeover bid in Europe's banking sector has shocked markets
item.description: Spanish bank BBVA caught markets by surprise after it announced a rare hostile takeover bid for domestic rival Banco Sabadell.

item.title: Norwegian wealth fund CEO converts a century-old grain silo into a $46 million art display to promote tourism in his hometown
item.description: Once home to 15,000 tons of grain, Norges Bank CEO Nicolai Tangen's Kunstsilo is now a gallery of more than 5,000 artworks.

item.title: Boeing cargo plane lands without front nose gear in Istanbul; investigation launched
item.description: Boeing is in the midst of its latest safety and public relations crisis after a door plug blew out from one of its 737 Max 9 planes midair in early January.

item.title: I'm a founder struggling with mental-health issues. How can I step away from my startup?
item.description: Bonobos and Pie founder Andy Dunn answers questions about how a founder can address mental health challenges, and how fast is too fast to grow.

item.title: Long pauses between Fed actions are historically good for stocks
item.description: Investors are deliberating when the Federal Reserve will start to lower rates, but the current pause could actually be a blessing in disguise for equities.

item.title: New York City’s watchdog investigates whether NYPD used official social media accounts to target public officials and private citizens
item.description: The Department of Investigation confirmed the probe, saying it was prompted by recent requests from City Council Speaker Adrienne Adams and the Legal Aid Society.

item.title: Chip designer Arm's shares plunge nearly 9% after lackluster revenue guidance
item.description: Shares of Arm fell almost 9% in premarket trading on Thursday, as lackluster revenue guidance from the firm clouded a positive sales quarter driven by AI demand.
